formatted_address: 254 Jurong East St 24, #01-62/63 Yuhua Village Market and Food Centre, Singapore 600254
name: Lee Swee Seng Provision

reviews.text: Bought fried threadfin fish maw ($27.80) & a packet of garlic ($2). Friendly & helpful shop owner. She explained patiently the different types of fish maw. I'll be back for more.

This is a dying breed of retail known locally as a provision shop.  These used to be small department stores when they occupied more room selling everything from dried foodstuffs, household goods, appliances, and supplies.  These mom and pop operations have been slowly replaced by the larger chain stores.  Lee Swee Seng still carries all the dried goods, spices, sauces, and canned food that youâ€™ll need for Chinese cooking. Worth a visit just to see what a legacy provision shop looks like.

vicinity: 254 Jurong East Street 24, #01-62/63 Yuhua Village Market and Food Centre
